comments: Show up to class, it\'s an easy way to get an A on 20% of the grade. Do the assignments, it\'s basically free points. The essays were not extremely tough to do; I think most people procrastinated on them. This teacher was very involved and gave great feedback on essays. It was my first 4.0 in an English class.

I don\'t get the people who complain that a class is hard or it\'s not possible to get good grades. Show up, try hard, and do the work and you\'ll be fine. He\'s not going to hand out 4.0\'s just because you came to class. I got a 4.0, it was tough but far from impossible. Use the feedback both he and your peers give and adjust your papers accordingly.
Jesse Ross was an amazing professor!
Very good teacher. It can be almost impossible to get 100% on papers, but that can be good because he really makes you try your best. Gives great feedback and has a lot of enthusiasm.
BAD teacher.20% of the grade will be attandance and class performance,,, if u dont like to answer questions in class,,,dont take him,,,, harsh grader,,,,i believe no one gets 3.8+
bad bad bad english teacher,,,, if u want 3.5 or higher,,,,dont ever ever take him,,,,no more than 2 ppl in my class get more than 3.5
Dont take him for english,,,,, he is such a harsh grader,,, no one could get 4.0 from him,,, he\'s such an aXXhole.

Incredibally attractive although occasionally assigns work that seems useless. Takes his work very serious and pushes actors for greatness. Pushs people out of their comfort zone and ends up with a great end result. Also incredibally attractive on a daily basis.

Not a good experience for intro to drama. For in-class written assignments I was docked points for not arguing Marxist theories; I didn\'t know that was a prerequisite for this class. A bit loquacious for my liking, especially when 90% of the class is just out of high school.
Jesse is a great professor: fun, intelligent, challenging, accessible.
